items.title: The type VI secretion system of Acinetobacter: mechanisms, biology and therapeutic potential
items.author: Lei Song
items.content: We synthesize advances in Acinetobacter T6SS biology, revealing how non-canonical structural solutions and multilayered regulation create an adaptable system for competition, persistence, and host immune modulation.

items.title: Reactive oxygen species-producing genes regulate mosquito midgut bacteria colonization, transcriptomic changes and cell repair
items.author: Olivier Andre Sparagano
items.content: In the Aedes Albopictus midgut, Nox—but not Duox—mainly drives reactive oxygen species production, which mediates the elimination of pathogenic bacteria, induces transcriptomic changes, and promotes epithelial repair

items.title: Bone marrow endosteum houses Hedgehog-susceptible Dlx5-expressing osteoblast precursor cells
items.author: Noriaki Ono
items.content: Dlx5+ cells in the postnatal bone marrow endosteum act as a transient but potent source of osteoblasts. Hedgehog activation in these precursors during bone growth shifts their fates toward adipocytes, leading to bone loss and spontaneous fractures.

items.title: Population coding for visual and auditory quantity in human numerotopic maps
items.author: Michael A. Skeide
items.content: Functional magnetic resonance imaging at 7 Tesla reveals an overarching coding scheme for visual and auditory numerosity in the human brain.

items.title: Afforestation of severely desertified land in semi-arid areas promotes soil carbon and nitrogen accumulation through microbial necromass
items.author: Jinliang Wang
items.content: The composite structural equation model reveals the mechanism by which microbial necromass promote soil carbon sequestration after afforestation in severely desertified land in semi-arid areas.

items.title: Generative models of cell dynamics: from Neural ODEs to flow matching
items.author: Fabian J. Theis
items.content: Neural ODEs unify continuous dynamics and neural networks to model cellular dynamics in single-cell omics. This review surveys applications from trajectory modling to gene regulatory network inference, highlighting technical innovations from Optimal Transport to Flow Matching.

items.title: DNA repair in darkness: evolutionary conservation of photolyase function beyond light
items.author: Zhiqiu Huang
items.content: A recent cavefish study overturns the classic view of photolyases as light-dependent enzymes. Research shows CPD photolyase repairs oxidative DNA damage in darkness, revealing a dual function that explains its conservation in cave species

items.title: ATPase N-ethylmaleimide-sensitive factor mediated calcium dependent fusion pore closure and endocytosis
items.author: Dongsheng Wang
items.content: N-ethylmaleimide-sensitive factor (NSF) mediated disassembly of trans-SNARE complexes is identified as the mechanism regulating fusion pore closure. This activity is critical for Ca²⁺dependent exo-endocytosis coupling and vesicle pool maintenance.
